intro: Zingiber acuminatum var. borneense, commonly known as Bornean ginger, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces showy, fragrant inflorescences with brightly colored bracts. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other ginger species. The botanical characteristics of this variety make it a valuable subject for both horticultural and pharmacological research.
